sources.note: Main landing page. Describes Medgen EHR as cloud-based ONC-certified system with specialty modules for addiction medicine and OB/GYN. Also mentions LABGEN LIS. Footer credits MEDFAR.
About page. Claims 35+ years experience, over 15,000 providers and 20 million patient interactions. Describes MEDFAR/Comtron combined entity.
ONC certification page. Shows 2015 Cures Complete EHR certification by Drummond. Links to mandatory disclosure and ambulatory compliance certificate PDFs.
Core EHR features page. Emphasizes mobile app with Nuance voice dictation, modular customization, disease management, and PQRS/accountable care reporting.
Addiction medicine specialty page. Describes methadone/buprenorphine inventory management, dispensing pump interfaces, drug screening, EPCS, service plans, incident management, counselor dashboards.
OB/GYN specialty page. Describes pregnancy tracking, antepartum/postpartum forms, EFW calculators, DICOM ultrasound interfaces, automated care plans, OB questionnaires in English/Spanish.
Billing page. Describes scheduling (up to 9 providers), EDI claim submission, charge capture, payment reconciliation, business intelligence reporting, payer mix analysis.
Blog post detailing methadone inventory control: automated pump reconciliation, lot number tracking, bottle-level tracking, spillage accounting, advanced dispensing reports.
Comtron USA corporate site. Confirms MEDFAR integration, lists Medgen EHR and LABGEN LIS products, describes lab and physician RCM services. Based in Great Neck, NY.

August 2024 press release announcing MEDFAR's integration of Comtron. MEDFAR is a Canadian EMR company (MYLE platform). Describes 15,000+ healthcare professionals, 25M+ patient interactions. Ambitious '5-5 goals' for global expansion.
Capterra listing. Only 3 reviews, 3.7/5 rating. Complaints about permission restrictions and charges for accessing old records after cancellation.
Software Advice listing for Medgen EHR. Limited review content.
iFax article describing Medgen EHR features: scheduling for 9 providers, medical billing, patient portal, voice recognition app, PQRS reporting. Noted telehealth as lacking (may be outdated).
EHR Guide article. Lists specialty templates (behavioral health, cardiology, GI, etc.), voice dictation, business intelligence reporting, financial analysis tools, OB/GYN-specific features.
EMR Industry listing. Confirms fully integrated billing, addiction medicine specialization (methadone/buprenorphine inventory), telemedicine, incident management, secure messaging, referral tracking.
MedicalRecords.com listing for Medgen EHR by Comtron Corp. Basic product listing.
